info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:31PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Hancock County through 700 PM CDT... At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ferris, or near Carthage, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carthage, Augusta, Bowen, Ferris, Adrian, Plymouth, Denver, Elvaston, Basco, Bentley and Hancock County Fairgrounds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
